title: Runcorn Silver Jubilee Bridge: Murder arrests over 'concerning' comments
article: Two men have been arrested on suspicion of murder after "concerning" comments were made by a man who parked his car on a bridge, police have said. Merseyside Police said a man was seen "acting suspiciously" on the Silver Jubilee Bridge, which links Runcorn and Widnes, at about 21:00 GMT on Saturday, though no body had been found. Officers later arrested a 43-year-old man in St Helens. A second man, aged 38, was subsequently arrested in Cheshire.A Merseyside Police spokeswoman said the first man, who was held on Saturday, had since been released under investigation, while the second, who was arrested on Monday morning, remained in custody. Det Supt Steve Reardon said officers were "making progress... and are keeping an open mind about what has happened". "I want to make it clear that our officers have not located anyone injured or deceased," he said. However, he said the "behaviour of the man on the bridge and comments he made were concerning". He added that the force, along with colleagues from Cheshire Police, wanted to hear from anyone who saw what happened or had dashcam footage taken on the bridge from between 20:30 and 21:00 on Saturday.
